title: Archives West
shortdesc: Finding aids or indexes to collections
description: A database containing finding aids from the University of Idaho and other organizations throughout the Pacific Northwest.

title: Main Library Catalog
shortdesc: Rare books and other archival materials
description: Some historical materials can only be found in the Main Library's General Catalog, such as our many rare book collections. In some cases, there may be circulating copies of materials that you can check out and take home!

title: HistPhoto
shortdesc: Descriptions of photos held in processed collections by Special Collections
description: The Historical Photograph Database (HistPhoto) is a table that consists of over 90,000 descriptions of individual images held by Special Collections. Images span 1830-2001 with the bulk of the images from the 1880s-1980s.

title: Digital Collections
shortdesc: Digitized images, documents, audio, video, maps, scores, newspapers, historical material
description: Our Digital Collections feature select digitized collections, curated online exhibits, and other digitized material held by Special Collections.

title: Browse Collections
description: Browse through a visual representation of all of our archival and book collections, sortable by subject and searchable by keyword.

title: Electronic Theses and Dissertations
shortdesc: Digitized U of I theses and dissertations
description: An open access repository of University of Idaho theses and dissertations.

title: Idaho Harvester blog
description: The Idaho Harvester features the most interesting and unique materials from Special Collections & Archives. We write about the images, stories, and historical narratives that catch our attention. Some posts are lengthier, dealing with complex subjects regarding Idaho history, industry, and the university, while others are shorter celebrations of notable days, people, and events.

title: Historic Newspaper Collection
shortdesc: Historic Idaho and local newspapers on microfilm
description: Historic newspapers are kept on microform and are available in the Library's general collections on the [third floor](/about/maps.html) of the library. You can search for newspapers by city, county, title, and a range of dates on this [index](/find/microfilm.html).
